name: Embassy Suites St. Louis - Downtown

reviews.text: All the amenities we are used to at Embassy suites hotels Plus a great location if you want to be downtown. Recently remodeled, the hotel was beautiful. And the breakfast was delicious! We didn't use the pool, but heard it was on the roof. We walked over to the Arch ( about 7 blocks). We'd like to go back when we can stay longer.
reviews.title: Beautiful! And walking distance to the Arch.

reviews.text: The parlor of the suite was the the most spacious Embassy Suites that I have stay in as of yet. Hotel and guestroom was very clean, spacious and modern.
reviews.title: July 2012
Good location.
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very professional, friendly and customer service attentive especially with my questions regarding directions around town as I am directionally challenged. LOL

I stayed here with my husband and 2 boys on our annual trip to a baseball filed. My boys are 11 and 8 and we walked to the arch and to the ball field and a few places in between - great location. Rooms were clean, front desk staff pleasant, breakfast was SUPERB as with all Embassy's as well as the great happy hour. My only complaint was the street noise was crazy loud. We checked in late our 1st night (11:30) and had a room on the 2nd floor facing apparently a pretty bust street. When I called down to see if we could be moved the hotel was booked and her response was "oh, your on _____ street. That will be like that until about 3:00. " argh... so needless to say me and one of my sons slept on the couch in the livingroom while my husband and other son slept in the bedroom beds. That would be my only piece of advice if you don't like to listen to LOUD street noise when you try to sleep.
reviews.title: First stay here, very nice

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a night as part of a baseball game trip. This is not your normal Embassy. It used to be a department store, so it's set up differently, and we really liked it. The rooms are big and the first thing you notice is the high ceilings. The decor is nice too. This was probably the best Embassy room that I've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: ALMOST as good as the Four Seasons!

reviews.text: I don't believe I have ever had the experience of a hotel moving, but in the case of Embassy Suites and Saint Louis the "move" delivered a far superior Embassy Suites hotel for Saint Louis. Several years ago the Saint Louis ES was on the historic river front Laclede's Landing. A more "traditional E.S. hotel, the open floor atrium style. But a dated hotel showing its age which was eventually sold and renamed.
reviews.title: An in depth review from a business traveler's perspective

reviews.text: Fast forward to 2011 and a new Embassy Suites was built along the trendy Washington Street "MX District". If a convenient, walk able downtown location is what you prefer you'll have it here in spades. Washington Street has numerous non-chain dining options from fusion, Italian, Japanese, Caribbean and much more. If for some reason that's not enough there's a light rail "Metrolink" station one block away that can take you further into and past the inner city.
reviews.title: Great new Downtown St Louis Hotel

reviews.text: Back to the present hotel; this Embassy Suites is of course new and modern and it's design is also forwarding thinking past the traditional E.S. rising high floor open atrium style of the 90s. While check in and reception is conducted on the first floor, the dining/breakfast area including a separate bar is located on the 4th floor. taking up most of the 4th floor's available space It's very open and spacious with tall ceilings and modern and trendy decor. I was told by a staff member that the atrium area was designed this way -in contrast to the older, rising, open floor designs- to reduce noise. It not only achieves that goal, it also looks very accommodating, and comfortable. The exercise and pool area, -yes there is an indoor pool- is all housed one floor above on 5. Like the rest of the hotel its clean and modern.
reviews.title: Just OK!

reviews.text: Let's talk suites. Once again the hotel took advantage of newer design trends and the suites reflect that as well. Spacious and well appointed, the suites looks much more inviting than the bland toned rooms of older E.S. designs. And back to noise reduction and privacy, each room has a closed wall and with a more private door to isolate you from hallway walkers and other traffic. Privacy wise this is far preferable over just windows with blinds and a thin door between your room and the outside world. Very nice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel except for breakfast

reviews.text: The rooms have comfortable, modern furniture; large flat screens; and mini bar with mini refrigerator. The bathroom has a glass walk in shower and the bedroom has a very comfortable king sized bed. The bedroom is well isolated from most outside sounds and of course has it's own larger flat screen as well.
reviews.title: Perfect location for a Cards game

reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel. It's clean & modern. The manager's reception was nice and so was the free breakfast. The pool is small & has way too much chlorine,but it's still nice. My family & I enjoyed every minute of our stay up until check out time. My son left his cellular phone in the room. No one turned it in, they pretended like it wasn't there. I know for sure it was there. That changed my entire experience. This quality hotel should have quality employees!!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed at Embassy Suites on vacation. The hotel is newly opened, the building repurposed from a department store. They've maintained the elegance and beauty of the historic building, while tastefully decorating the rooms with modern decor. Our room had very high ceilings with ceiling to floor window treatments. The room was very quiet! We appreciated the framed art of when the building had been in use as Famous-Barr Department store. A great addition to the downtown options for lodging.
reviews.title: Embassy - Sweet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet attendents were helpful and courteous. We missed the manager's reception, but did enjoy the full breakfast and wonderful omelets prepared by Miss Helen - delicious!
reviews.title: Not your typical Embassy Suites but nice.

reviews.text: Nice restaurants within three blocks walking distance of the hotel - loved Mango's peruvian food! We walked to the Jefferson Memorial Park and St. Louis Arch. Management locked up our luggage after check-out so we could tour the Arch before leaving town, without paying for other parking. Perfect location for downtown activities including baseball, riverfront and Arch activities, and shopping at Macy's.
reviews.title: Great room, excellent location, nice old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet parking was what you expect in a downtown area, but a bit pricey at $27. The only complaint was the cost of sundries. They charged $11+ for a Stouffers frozen french bread pizza and ice cream bar for a bottomless pit teenager. Turns out you can't prepare the pizza in your microwave, only defrost it - so why sell it?
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: The Embassy Suites in downtown St. Louis is in a perfect location! It is very close to Busch Stadium, the convention center, and to where the Rams play. The front desk staff is very helpful and accommodating. The valet staff is very friendly as well! The rooms are huge and can fit a large family in each suite. The hotel is decorated beautifully. The parking is outrageously expensive for both valet and self-parking. The breakfast could be much fresher. I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and the food here definitely does not measure up to Embassy Suites' standards. The manager's reception food was also a bit ho-hum. But room service was fantastic!! The one big negative at this location was that I liked to have my sheet changed daily, so I put the card on my bed to ask housekeeping to do this, and my sheets were not changed the five days I was there. That is a personal preference not a deal breaker for me. It just made my rating go down a bit for this property.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites this past weekend and it was just delightful. Such a beautiful hotel and so close to everything. The room was huge and the staff so very accommodating. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in St. Louis. It is close to the zoo, St. Louis Botanical Gardens, City Park, Cardinal Stadium and the Arch. My granddaughters loved the breakfast which was included. There was a huge selection and an omelet station. Fabulous.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Embassy Suites Downtown in St. Louis is walking distance to the Arch, and there are lots of restaurants just around the corner on Washington Ave. It is right next to the convention center, and a few blocks from Busch Stadium. Check in was short and sweet. Our room was clean, quiet, and nicely furnished. My complaints about this hotel would be that free wi fi is only available in the public areas. The hotel is huge, so getting to the lobby was an ordeal from the location of our room. The other complaint is that there is no self-park. If you don't want to use the $27 a day valet parking, you have to go to a park-garage a couple of blocks away.
reviews.title: Convenient and reasonable price

reviews.text: This Embassy Suites is fabulous! Such a great rehab/renovation of an old department store - no expense spared from my perspective. Rooms are spacious and decorated very nicely. Such a comfortable night's sleep. Breakfast was fabulous - best omelettes ever!
reviews.title: Awesome experience! You will love it!

reviews.text: Location is great for business and leisure travelers. Fabulous restaurants along Washington, next door to convention center, 15 minute walk to the Arch - I only wish it had a view, but you can't have everything I suppose.
reviews.title: Quick Stop, Great Choice

description: The Embassy Suites St. Louis – Downtown hotel in Missouri is conveniently located in the historic Laurel Building in the heart of downtown St. Louis across the street from America's Convention Center and the Edward Jones Dome - home to the NFL's St. Louis Rams. With easy access from I-70, I-64, I-44 and I-55, our Embassy Suites hotel is the centerpiece of the exciting new Mercantile Exchange District currently under development. Lambert St. Louis International Airport is only 14 miles away and the MetroLink light rail systems Convention Center station is less than a block away.
